alert.note: Alert for Potomac, Seeley Lake Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 18 at 2:25PM MST until February 22 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM SUNDAY TO 11 PM MST MONDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches through this evening. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches for the Seeley/Swan valleys and 2 to 4 inches along Interstate 90. Winds gusting as high as 20 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 12. Blowing and drifting snow, dangerously cold wind chills and a freeze up on roadways is possible Tuesday afternoon with an arctic front passage. * WHERE...Highway 200 Bonner to Greenough, Highway 83 Seeley Lake to Condon, and I-90 East Missoula to Bearmouth. * WHEN...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, until 7 PM MST this evening. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, from 11 AM Sunday to 11 PM MST Monday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Monday evening through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 35 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
